p: P. domestica essential oils were more active than P. armeniaca essential oils in inhibiting lipid peroxidation using the β-carotene-linoleic acid test system. IC 50 values in the range of 11.15–14.75 μg/mL and 11.39–16.19 μg/mL after 30 and 60 min of incubation were found for the essential oils, P4–P6.
